content.body: Is a child browsing context ever not 1:1 with its navigable?

Always 1:1, indeed.

content.body: (until everyone has out of process iframe tech and then we can start introducing cool stuff like BCG swaps for iframes?)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: (until everyone has out of process iframe tech and then we can start introducing cool stuff like BCG swaps for iframes?)

content.body: I don't think that ends up having much meaning as a BCG only cares about top-level BCs.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I don't think that ends up having much meaning as a BCG only cares about top-level BCs.

content.body: Perhaps this is something we can simplify then whereby we only have top-level BCs.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Perhaps this is something we can simplify then whereby we only have top-level BCs.

content.body: Hmm. We'd still need WindowProxys for children, but maybe indeed the BC concept is not helpful... unsure.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Hmm. We'd still need WindowProxys for children, but maybe indeed the BC concept is not helpful... unsure.

content.body: I guess a child browsing context might still be useful as a thing that can be targeted and end up with an opener. Even if we don't replace it. It feels very niche, but maybe I just need to get used to it.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I guess a child browsing context might still be useful as a thing that can be targeted and end up with an opener. Even if we don't replace it. It feels very niche, but maybe I just need to get used to it.

content.body: Ugh, children can have openers? That's gross.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Ugh, children can have openers? That's gross.

content.body: Name targeting is the original sin, but yes.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Name targeting is the original sin, but yes.

content.body: I think navigables are the things that are targeted now, but sometimes we decide not to carry over their name when doing a navigation.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I think navigables are the things that are targeted now, but sometimes we decide not to carry over their name when doing a navigation.

content.body: Hmm, so COOP definitely wants fresh name and such. And name targeting in theory walks through the BCG's TLBCs.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Hmm, so COOP definitely wants fresh name and such. And name targeting in theory walks through the BCG's TLBCs.

content.body: I was really hoping we could collapse "is auxiliary" and "has an opener" but it seems like if children can have an opener that's unlikely...

content.body: Maybe moving name to navigable was a mistake then...

content.body:
Yeah, I'm also a little worried about this line:

> Modern specifications should avoid using the browsing context concept in most cases, unless they are dealing with the subtleties of browsing context group switches and agent cluster allocation. Instead, the Document and navigable concepts are usually more appropriate.

Because I wouldn't want anyone to be able to cast an even wider net than a browsing context.
content.formatted_body:

Because I wouldn't want anyone to be able to cast an even wider net than a browsing context.

content.body: But if it's for traversal through the tree of documents it seems okay.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But if it's for traversal through the tree of documents it seems okay.

content.body: It's very rare that a spec (besides HTML itself) wants to have different behavior after BCG swaps.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It's very rare that a spec (besides HTML itself) wants to have different behavior after BCG swaps.

content.body: Ah, I guess you're specifically referring to same-origin swaps. And that makes sense. But navigables can span many origins so putting state on them would be rather dangerous.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Ah, I guess you're specifically referring to same-origin swaps. And that makes sense. But navigables can span many origins so putting state on them would be rather dangerous.
